com.jc.ldap.activedirectory.listener

Class EventListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • com.jc.ldap.activedirectory.listener.EventListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    com.jc.ldap.activedirectory.listener.DirSyncEventListener

    public abstract class EventListener
extends java.lang.Thread
    Abstract implementation for building a robust threaded ldap event listener for object changes.
    Author:
    John Carter

    • Constructor Detail

      • EventListener

        public EventListener(java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> env,
                     java.lang.String searchBase,
                     javax.naming.directory.SearchControls searchCtls,
                     java.lang.String debugLevel)
              throws javax.naming.NamingException
        Establish a listener object
        Parameters:
        env - Hashtable of ldap attributes to setup connection
        searchBase - directory root to scan, must a valid domain partition
        searchFilter - filter for active directory search (e.g. (&(objectClass=person)(objectClass=user))
        returnAttributes - Optional list of attributes to check for updates, otherwise all attributes will be checked
        SearchControls - Defines criteria for search such subtree and attributes to return
        Throws:
        javax.naming.NamingException

      • startup

        public void startup(long restartInterval)
        This is the primary method to be called to start up the service, returns immediately with the startup and run look managed in separate threads. Use pleaseStop() to gracefully shutdown. Any connection errors are logged via your implementation of #logError()
        Parameters:
        restartInterval - - Optional parameter to force the reconnection after the given interval

      • pleaseStop

        public void pleaseStop()
                throws javax.naming.NamingException
        Call this method to gracefully shutdown the listener
        Throws:
        javax.naming.NamingException

      • isStopping

        public boolean isStopping()
        Return true if pleaseStop() has been called on this listener
        Returns:
        true if stopping, false pleaseStop() not called
